00033 struct heapobj;

00043         int flags;

00073 size_t get_used_size(void *pool);
00074 void destroy_memory_pool(void *pool);
00075 size_t add_new_area(void *pool, size_t size, void *mem);
00076 void *malloc_ex(size_t size, void *pool);
00077 void free_ex(void *pool, void *ptr);
00078 void *tlsf_malloc(size_t size);
00079 void tlsf_free(void *ptr);
00080 size_t malloc_usable_size_ex(void *ptr, void *pool);
00081 
00082 static inline
00083 void pvheapobj_destroy(struct heapobj *hobj)
00084 {
00085         destroy_memory_pool(hobj->pool);
00086 }
00087 
00088 static inline
00089 int pvheapobj_extend(struct heapobj *hobj, size_t size, void *mem)
00090 {
00091         hobj->size = add_new_area(hobj->pool, size, mem);
00092         if (hobj->size == (size_t)-1)
00093                 return __bt(-EINVAL);
00094 
00095         return 0;
00096 }
00097 
00098 static inline
00099 void *pvheapobj_alloc(struct heapobj *hobj, size_t size)
00100 {
00101         return malloc_ex(size, hobj->pool);
00102 }
00103 
00104 static inline
00105 void pvheapobj_free(struct heapobj *hobj, void *ptr)
00106 {
00107         free_ex(ptr, hobj->pool);
00108 }
00109 
00110 static inline
00111 size_t pvheapobj_validate(struct heapobj *hobj, void *ptr)
00112 {
00113         return malloc_usable_size_ex(ptr, hobj->pool);
00114 }
00115 
00116 static inline
00117 size_t pvheapobj_inquire(struct heapobj *hobj)
00118 {
00119         return get_used_size(hobj->pool);
00120 }
00121 
00122 static inline void *pvmalloc(size_t size)
00123 {
00124         return tlsf_malloc(size);
00125 }
00126 
00127 static inline void pvfree(void *ptr)
00128 {
00129         tlsf_free(ptr);
00130 }
00131 
00132 static inline char *pvstrdup(const char *ptr)
00133 {
00134         char *str;
00135 
00136         str = pvmalloc(strlen(ptr) + 1);
00137         if (str == NULL)
00138                 return NULL;
00139 
00140         return strcpy(str, ptr);
00141 }
00142 
00143 #else /* !CONFIG_XENO_TLSF, i.e. malloc */
00144 
00145 #include <malloc.h>
00146 
00147 static inline
00148 void pvheapobj_destroy(struct heapobj *hobj)
00149 {
00150 }
00151 
00152 static inline
00153 int pvheapobj_extend(struct heapobj *hobj, size_t size, void *mem)
00154 {
00155         return 0;
00156 }
00157 
00158 static inline
00159 void *pvheapobj_alloc(struct heapobj *hobj, size_t size)
00160 {
00161         /*
00162          * XXX: We don't want debug _nrt assertions to trigger when
00163          * running over Cobalt if the user picked this allocator, so
00164          * we make sure to call the glibc directly, not the Cobalt
00165          * wrappers.
00166          */
00167         return __STD(malloc(size));
00168 }
00169 
00170 static inline
00171 void pvheapobj_free(struct heapobj *hobj, void *ptr)
00172 {
00173         __STD(free(ptr));
00174 }
00175 
00176 static inline
00177 size_t pvheapobj_validate(struct heapobj *hobj, void *ptr)
00178 {
00179         /*
00180          * We will likely get hard validation here, i.e. crash or
00181          * abort if the pointer is wrong. TLSF is a bit smarter, and
00182          * pshared definitely does the right thing.
00183          */
00184         return malloc_usable_size(ptr);
00185 }
00186 
00187 static inline
00188 size_t pvheapobj_inquire(struct heapobj *hobj)
00189 {
00190         struct mallinfo m = mallinfo();
00191         return m.uordblks;
00192 }
00193 
00194 static inline void *pvmalloc(size_t size)
00195 {
00196         return __STD(malloc(size));
00197 }
00198 
00199 static inline void pvfree(void *ptr)
00200 {
00201         __STD(free(ptr));
00202 }
00203 
00204 static inline char *pvstrdup(const char *ptr)
00205 {
00206         return strdup(ptr);
00207 }

00209 #endif /* !CONFIG_XENO_TLSF */
00210 
00211 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_PSHARED
00212 
00213 /*
00214  * The heap control block is always heading the shared memory segment,
00215  * so that any process can access this information right after the
00216  * segment is mmapped. This also ensures that offset 0 will never
00217  * refer to a valid page or block.
00218  */
00219 extern void *__pshared_heap;
00220 #define main_heap               (*((struct heap *)__pshared_heap))
00221 
00222 extern struct hash_table *__pshared_catalog;
00223 #define main_catalog            (*((struct hash_table *)__pshared_catalog))
00224 
00225 static inline void *mainheap_ptr(memoff_t off)
00226 {
00227         return off ? (void *)__memptr(__pshared_heap, off) : NULL;
00228 }
00229 
00230 static inline memoff_t mainheap_off(void *addr)
00231 {
00232         return addr ? (memoff_t)__memoff(__pshared_heap, addr) : 0;
00233 }
00234 
00235 /*
00236  * ptr shall point to a block of memory allocated within the main heap
00237  * if non-null; such address is always 8-byte aligned. Handles of
00238  * shared heap pointers are returned with bit #0 set, which serves as
00239  * a special tag detected in mainhead_deref(). A null pointer is
00240  * always translated as a null handle.
00241  */
00242 #define mainheap_ref(ptr, type)                                         \
00243         ({                                                              \
00244                 type handle;                                            \
00245                 assert(__builtin_types_compatible_p(typeof(type), unsigned long) || \
00246                        __builtin_types_compatible_p(typeof(type), uintptr_t)); \
00247                 assert(ptr == NULL || __memchk(__pshared_heap, ptr));   \
00248                 handle = (type)mainheap_off(ptr);                       \
00249                 handle|1;                                               \
00250         })
00251 /*
00252  * Handles of shared heap-based pointers have bit #0 set. Other values
00253  * are not translated, and the return value is the original handle
00254  * cast to a pointer. A null handle is always returned unchanged.
00255  */
00256 #define mainheap_deref(handle, type)                                    \
00257         ({                                                              \
00258                 type *ptr;                                              \
00259                 assert(__builtin_types_compatible_p(typeof(handle), unsigned long) || \
00260                        __builtin_types_compatible_p(typeof(handle), uintptr_t)); \
00261                 ptr = (handle & 1) ? (type *)mainheap_ptr(handle & ~1UL) : (type *)handle; \
00262                 ptr;                                                    \
00263         })
00264

00303 /*
00304  * Whether an object is laid in some shared heap. Never if pshared
00305  * mode is disabled.
00306  */
00307 static inline int pshared_check(void *heap, void *addr)
00308 {
00309         return 0;
00310 }
00311 
00312 #define mainheap_ref(ptr, type)                                         \
00313         ({                                                              \
00314                 type handle;                                            \
00315                 assert(__builtin_types_compatible_p(typeof(type), unsigned long) || \
00316                        __builtin_types_compatible_p(typeof(type), uintptr_t)); \
00317                 assert(ptr == NULL || __memchk(__pshared_heap, ptr));   \
00318                 handle = (type)ptr;                                     \
00319                 handle;                                                 \
00320         })
00321 #define mainheap_deref(handle, type)                                    \
00322         ({                                                              \
00323                 type *ptr;                                              \
00324                 assert(__builtin_types_compatible_p(typeof(handle), unsigned long) || \
00325                        __builtin_types_compatible_p(typeof(handle), uintptr_t)); \
00326                 ptr = (type *)handle;                                   \
00327                 ptr;                                                    \
00328         })

00347 static inline int heapobj_init_shareable(struct heapobj *hobj,
00348                                          const char *name, size_t size)
00349 {
